conbody.p: Format of CCR message is supported as per 32.299 and RFC 4006. Support of each AVP of CCR message by NCC is described in the following table. This table is common for Gy, IMS, SMS, and MMS interfaces:

row.entry: Refer to dedicated section of this AVP in this document
This field defines the request type: event for event based charging and initial, update, terminate for session based charging. Event is used for SMS/MMS calls.
Supported as per 3GPP 32.299. It must start with 0 (Zero) value in CCR-I and incremental in further request i.e. CCR-U/T.

entry.p: On receiving the OSI value greater than the previous one in a diameter request, NCC deletes all the diameter sessions, for a given interface, which are associated with the older OSI.

row.entry: This AVP must be present in all request, that is, CCR-I, CCR-U, and CCR-T.

entry.p: E.164 value must start with Country Code.
In case of SIP_URI is used, Device in NCC must be created with exact value of SIP_URI as coming in this AVP

row.entry: Only DIRECT_DEBITING action is supported and used for SMS/MMS calls
Supported only for Gy calls. If one or all out of CC-Total-Octets, CC-Input-Octets and CC-Output-Octets are present, then only first in the sequence is considered by NCC, rest are ignored
Supported only for Gy calls. If one or all out of CC-Total-Octets, CC-Input-Octets and CC-Output-Octets are present, then only first in the sequence is considered by NCC, rest are ignored
Supported only for Gy calls. If one or all out of CC-Total-Octets, CC-Input-Octets and CC-Output-Octets are present, then only first in the sequence is considered by NCC, rest are ignored
This field contains the amount of used non-monetary service units measured for a particular category to a particular quota type.
Supported only for Gy calls. If one or all out of CC-Total-Octets, CC-Input-Octets and CC-Output-Octets are present, then only first in the sequence is considered by NCC, rest are ignored
Supported only for Gy calls. If one or all out of CC-Total-Octets, CC-Input-Octets and CC-Output-Octets are present, then only first in the sequence is considered by NCC, rest are ignored
Supported only for Gy calls. If one or all out of CC-Total-Octets, CC-Input-Octets and CC-Output-Octets are present, then only first in the sequence is considered by NCC, rest are ignored

entry.p: Over IMS Ro, Service-Identifier is recommended to be present
For Gy Rating-Group is recommended to present

row.entry: Supported as per 3GPP 32.299. Refer to respective interface details for the same

ul.li: “Not Supported” indicates that NCC does not perform any logic processing for these AVPs.
“Supported by NCC rules” indicates that value of such AVPs can be used in rules for decision making. It does not mean there is any core logic exist in NCC around these AVPs.
All AVPs that are of multiple occurrence type, only the first occurrence is supported in rule.

conbody.p: Format of CCA message is supported as per 3GPP 32.299 and RFC 4006. Support of each AVP of CCA message by NCC product is described in below table which is common for Gy/IMS/SMS/MMS interface:

row.entry: Refer to dedicated section of this AVP in this document
This field defines the request type: event for event based charging and initial, update, terminate for session based charging. Event is used for SMS/MMS calls.
Supported as per 3GPP 32.299. Not applicable for IEC calls.

entry.p: Over IMS Ro, Service-Identifier is recommended to be present
For Gy Rating-Group is recommended to present

row.entry: Refer to dedicated section of this AVP in this document
Supported only for IEC calls i.e. SMS/MMS

ul.li: “Not Supported” indicates that NCC does not perform any logic processing for these AVPs.
“Supported by NCC rules” indicates that value of such AVPs can be used in rules for decision making. It does not mean there is any core logic exist in NCC around these AVPs.
All AVPs that are of multiple occurrence type, only the first occurrence is supported in rule.

conbody.p: Format of RAR message is supported as per 3GPP and RFC 4006. Support of each AVP of RAR message by NCC product is described in following table.
conbody.note: “Not Supported” indicates that NCC does not perform any logic processing for these AVPs.

conbody.p: Format of RAA message is supported as per 3GPP and RFC 4006. Support of each AVP of RAA message by NCC product is described in following table.
conbody.note: “Not Supported” indicates that NCC does not perform any logic processing for these AVPs.

conbody.p: Format of ASR message is supported as per 3GPP and RFC 4006. AVPs of ASR message supported by NCC are described as follows:

fig.codeblock:
<ASR> ::= < Diameter Header: 274, REQ, PXY >
   < Session-Id >
   { Origin-Host }
   { Origin-Realm }
   { Destination-Realm }
   { Destination-Host }
   { Auth-Application-Id }

conbody.p: Format of ASA message is supported as per 3GPP and RFC 4006. AVPs of ASA message supported by NCC are described as follows:
conbody.codeblock:
<ASA> ::= < Diameter Header: 274, PXY >
   < Session-Id >
   { Result-Code }
   { Origin-Host }
   { Origin-Realm }

conbody.p: Supported Service-Context-Id by NCC are as follows:
Service-Context-Id AVPs must contain the above string to identify the type of call. For example, 6.32251@3gpp.org identifies PS charging.
The Result-Code AVP is available at two levels, that is, at Command level and at MSCC level.

ul.li: If diameter request is successfully authorized and authenticated, then Result-Code at command level is always 2001 irrespective of the result code at MSCC level, which can be 2x, 4x, or 5x.
If diameter request is rejected due to any permanent failure, then appropriate 5x Result-Code is sent in CCA.
If there is a processing delay in NCC application, then the appropriate 3x or 5x Result-Code is sent in CCA.

conbody.p: Result code at MSCC level is set with an appropriate value based on the processing of a given MSCC by NCC application.
Sessions in NCC application are either terminated with a CCR-T request or cleaned by a session audit logic, if the session is found as stale.

A CCR-T is processed whether a wrong MSCC or no MSCC value is received. However, if MSCC has an entry in the Diameter Gy session but the MSCC value is not received for a CCR-T, then an alarm is raised.
conbody.note: The RSU AVP value is ignored in a CCR-T request.

conbody.p: ECUR and SCUR are supported as per 3GPP considering the support shown in CCR message () and NCC Standards Compliance Reference.
